avalancheActivity.highlights: The snow has melted considerably in warm weather and rain earlier this week. Some new snow is forecast in the mountains in generally calm winds.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snow has melted considerably in warm weather and rain earlier this week. Some new snow is forecast in the mountains. The underlying snowpack is generally considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow but not it is snowing again on top of wet snow which leads to faciting with a weak layer forming at that interface
travelAdvisory.highlights: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow but not it is snowing again on top of wet snow which leads to faciting with a weak layer forming at that interface

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægur vindur og SV-éljagangur á laugardag en hlýnar og hvessir í S-átt á sunnudag og smávegis skúrir fylgja.

avalancheActivity.comment: Sluffs fell on Súðavíkuhlíð and Bolungarvík on 4 and 5 February.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New wind slabs have formed in snowfall and snowdrift especially in N to NE slopes. Wet avalanches will become more likely in thaw and rain on Sunday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snowfall and snowdrift may have formed new wind slabs on top of the stable snow especially in N-NE slopes. Wet avalanches will become more likely in thaw and rain on Sunday.

travelAdvisory.comment: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow but not it is snowing again on top of wet snow which leads to faciting with a weak layer forming at that interface
travelAdvisory.highlights: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow but not it is snowing again on top of wet snow which leads to faciting with a weak layer forming at that interface

weatherForecast.highlights: Breytilegur vindur með éljagangi á föstudagsmorgun en bætir í síðdegis. Hægviðri, kalt og lítilsháttar snjókoma á laugardag. S-átt, hlýtt og úrkoma á sunnudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Cooling after the thaw this week may cause the snow to harden in the mountains. Wind slabs may form on northerly aspects durins SW-snow showers.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Signficant snow melt has occurred this week. Warm weather this week and intense thawing has wet the snow which is now considered stable. Now the termperatures are below freezing and the odl snow is expected to form a hard surface. But during SW-snow showers, wind slabs may form on northerly aspects and cause a high temperature gradient and faceting on the boundary.

travelAdvisory.comment: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow but not it is snowing again on top of wet snow which leads to faciting with a weak layer forming at that interface
travelAdvisory.highlights: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow but not it is snowing again on top of wet snow which leads to faciting with a weak layer forming at that interface

avalancheActivity.highlights: Thin layer of moist new snow on top of older snow that is considered mostly stable

snowpackStructure.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted due to warm temperatures and rain lately. After strong melting the snow pack is expected to be isothermal and stable. A thin layer of new snow came on Friday that is moist. Small sluffs could release in steep slopes but larger avalanches not expected.

travelAdvisory.comment: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow but not it is snowing again on top of wet snow which leads to faciting with a weak layer forming at that interface
travelAdvisory.highlights: Melt-freeze cycles last week have stabilized the snow but not it is snowing again on top of wet snow which leads to faciting with a weak layer forming at that interface

weatherForecast.highlights: Snjóaði nokkra cm í hægum vindi á föstudag rigndi í kjölfarið á lágelndi. Hæglætis veður fram á mánudga og úrkomulítið.
